webvr a-frame app, angela merkel's house
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Certainly! Below is a simple WebVR (A-Frame) example that creates a basic 3D scene representing "Angela Merkel's House". In this example, I’m not representing a specific architectural design but creating a simple representation of a house for demonstration purposes. You can expand or customize this model further as needed.

Make sure that you are running this code in a local web server environment or through a web environment that supports WebVR/A-Frame.

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Angela Merkel's House - WebVR A-Frame Demo</title>
    <script src="https://aframe.io/releases/1.2.0/aframe.min.js"></script>
    <style>
        body {
            margin: 0;
            font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe UI", "Roboto", "Helvetica Neue", "Arial", sans-serif;
        }
        a-scene {
            height: 100vh;
        }
        .text-entity {
            color: black;
            font-family: monospace;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <a-scene embedded>
        <!-- Environment -->
        <a-sky color="#87CEEB"></a-sky>
        <a-ground color="#A9A9A9" height="100" width="100"></a-ground>

        <!-- House Structure -->
        <a-box position="0 1 -5" depth="4" height="3" width="4" color="#8B4513"></a-box> <!-- Walls -->
        <a-cone position="0 4 -5" radius-bottom="3" radius-top="0" height="2" color="#B22222"></a-cone> <!-- Roof -->
        
        <!-- Door -->
        <a-box position="0 1 -5.01" depth="0.1" height="2" width="1" color="#fff" shadow></a-box>

        <!-- Windows -->
        <a-box position="-1.5 2 -5.01" depth="0.1" height="1" width="1" color="#ADD8E6" shadow></a-box>
        <a-box position="1.5 2 -5.01" depth="0.1" height="1" width="1" color="#ADD8E6" shadow></a-box>
        
        <!-- Text  -->
        <a-text value="Angela Merkel's House" position="-2 6 -5" color="black" align="center" class="text-entity"></a-text>
        
        <!-- Light -->
        <a-light type="ambient" color="#ffffff"></a-light>
        <a-light type="directional" position="-1 2 1" intensity="0.5"></a-light>
        
        <!-- VR button for experience -->
        <a-entity camera look-controls position="0 1.6 0">
            <a-entity position="0 -0.6 0" text="value: Enter VR; color: #000;"></a-entity>
        </a-entity>
        
    </a-scene>
</body>
</html>
```

### Instructions to Run:

1. **Copy the Code**: Copy the entire code block above.
2. **Create an HTML File**: Open a text editor (like Visual Studio Code, Notepad++, or any IDE) and paste the copied code into a new file.
3. **Save the File**: Save the file with an `.html` extension (e.g., `index.html`).
4. **Host Locally**: You may need to serve it via a local server (you can use Python’s built-in server if you have Python installed):
   - Open a terminal or command prompt.
   - Navigate to the directory where the file is saved.
   - Run `python -m http.server` (Python 3) or `python -m SimpleHTTPServer` (Python 2).
5. **Open in Browser**: Open a web browser and go to `http://localhost:8000` (or the port your server indicates).

### Experience in VR:
If you have access to a VR headset, you should be able to enter the VR view by clicking the VR button that appears in the scene when you load the webpage.

Feel free to modify the shapes, colors, or dimensions of the house to better fit your vision!
